intro: Siphocampylus cavanillesianus, commonly known as the Cavanilles' siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, showcasing adaptations to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are usually compound, with a pinnate structure, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Siphocampylus cavanillesianus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native range.
